title: 114_hr6248
content: The "Spending Safeguard Act" may be cited as the short title. It includes a spending limitation on direct spending programs. The Spending Safeguard Act establishes a spending limitation for direct spending programs, to be determined by the Director of the Office of Management and Budget within 90 days of enactment or reauthorization. The Spending Safeguard Act sets spending limits for direct spending programs, determined by the Director of the Office of Management and Budget within 90 days. The limitation for programs falls under specific budget functions, with different percentages based on the program's cost. The Spending Safeguard Act establishes spending limits for programs based on their costs, with different percentages for different budget functions. The cost of the program is determined by the Director using scorecards or estimates from the Statutory Pay-As-You-Go Act of 2010. The Director determines program costs using scorecards or estimates from the Statutory Pay-As-You-Go Act of 2010. A spending safeguard limitation scorecard is maintained for programs subject to this Act, displaying their spending levels. The Secretary of the Treasury must report monthly spending for direct spending programs subject to a spending safeguard limitation. The Director submits a biannual report to the Committees on the Budget regarding program costs. The Director submits a biannual report to the Committees on the Budget detailing the total spending for direct spending programs subject to a spending safeguard limitation. The Director submits a biannual report to the Committees on the Budget detailing the total spending for direct spending programs subject to a spending safeguard limitation. Section 1105(a) of title 31, United States Code, is amended to include a report on the total level of spending for such programs and their relation to the spending safeguard limitation. Section 1106(a)(1)(C) is also amended to reflect this change. Section 1106(a)(1)(C) of title 31, United States Code, is amended to include a new spending safeguard limitation. If the Director determines that a direct spending program will breach this limitation within six months, a report must be transmitted within 15 days. The Director must report to the Committees on the Budget if a direct spending program will exceed the spending safeguard limitation within six months. The Director must report to the Committees on the Budget if a direct spending program will exceed the spending safeguard limitation within six months. If the Director determines that a program has reached the limitation, funds cannot be obligated for the program and a report must be submitted to the relevant committees. The Director must report to the Budget Committees if a direct spending program exceeds the spending safeguard limit. Federal agencies must inform program participants that the program is subject to this limit. The spending program must inform participants about a spending safeguard limitation that could affect future fund availability. Definitions for "Director" and "direct spending" are provided in the Act. The term "direct spending program" refers to any Federal program funded by direct spending that is enacted or reauthorized after the date of enactment of the Act and does not have a specific level of authorization of appropriations in statute. No additional funds are authorized to be appropriated for this Act.
